solution.text:
_{j}__{k}__{l}_ can be represented as - \( (100 \times _{j}_) + (10 \times _{k}_) + _{l}_ \)
_{k}__{l}__{j}_ can be represented as - \( (100 \times _{k}_) + (10 \times _{l}_) + _{j}_ \)
_{l}__{j}__{k}_ can be represented as - \( (100 \times _{l}_) + (10 \times _{j}_) + _{k}_ \)
Adding all 3 we get \( (111 \times _{j}_) + (111 \times _{k}_) + (111 \times _{l}_)\).
This can be written as - \( ((37 \times 3) \times (_{j}_ + _{k}_ + _{l}_)) \).
\(\Rightarrow\) Therefore the number is divisible by both 3 and 37.

content.text: Take the sum of three numbers , _{j}__{k}__{l}_ , _{k}__{l}__{j}_ and _{l}__{j}__{k}_ . What number(s) is this number divisible by ?
